title: Orchid Identification
description: Orchids are the largest family of flowering plants! How well do you know these exotic and elegant blooms?

questions.question: Which orchid genus is the most commonly sold as a houseplant, known for its moth-shaped flowers?
How many known species of orchids exist worldwide, making them the largest flowering plant family?
Which orchid is called the "Dancing Lady" orchid because its flowers resemble a woman in a flowing skirt?
What popular flavoring is derived from the seed pods of the Vanilla orchid?
Most orchids in tropical forests are epiphytes. What does this mean?
options: They grow on other plants without being parasitic

questions.question: Which large, fragrant orchid was once called the "Queen of Orchids" and is often used in corsages?
The Lady's Slipper orchid gets its name from what distinctive feature?
options: Its color resembles a lady's shoe
It has a pouch-shaped lip resembling a slipper
It was discovered by a woman named Slipper

questions.question: Which orchid genus has long, arching sprays of small flowers and is popular for wedding arrangements?
What specialized relationship do many orchid seeds require to germinate in the wild?
The "Spider Orchid" (Brassia) has elongated petals and sepals that resemble what?
Which orchid is known for its brilliant blue-purple color and needs bright light, often grown in hanging baskets?
What is the thick, spongy covering on orchid aerial roots called?
Which tiny orchid variety, growing only a few inches tall, is sometimes called the "Jewel Orchid" for its decorative leaves?
Some orchids mimic the appearance and scent of female insects to attract male pollinators. What is this strategy called?
On which continent are orchids NOT found growing naturally?
